pullrequest.title: Add tutorials for hardware / simulation bridging (#337)

content.raw:
Ah, you want pure lock-step, with the simulation willing to wait indefinitely for a new command from the controller.  As far as I can see, that's not possible with the current synchronization mechanism in AtlasPlugin.  While it turns out that you can [set the synchronization parameters via ROS](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/c13fb7bd021501f25b2115c90af4f85e1ad58b63/ros/atlas_msgs/AtlasPlugin.cpp?at=default#cl-590), the best that you could do is to set the `Max` values to be very large; and still simulation would tick forward eventually, albeit slowly.

I think that we should add a mode to AtlasPlugin that makes it wait indefinitely when the latest received command is older than some duration (in simulation time).  If that will work for you, then could you please open a feature request issue describing how you'd like it to work?

Strictly speaking, adding the indefinite wait mode is independent of the changes proposed in this pull request, which will should be useful as is for some teams.
content.html:
Ah, you want pure lock-step, with the simulation willing to wait indefinitely for a new command from the controller. As far as I can see, that's not possible with the current synchronization mechanism in AtlasPlugin. While it turns out that you can set the synchronization parameters via ROS, the best that you could do is to set the Max values to be very large; and still simulation would tick forward eventually, albeit slowly.

I think that we should add a mode to AtlasPlugin that makes it wait indefinitely when the latest received command is older than some duration (in simulation time). If that will work for you, then could you please open a feature request issue describing how you'd like it to work?

Strictly speaking, adding the indefinite wait mode is independent of the changes proposed in this pull request, which will should be useful as is for some teams.
